contentrichtext.text: {{Expand German|Cryptomonas|date=May 2012}} {{Taxobox | regnum = [[Chromalveolata]] | phylum = [[Cryptophyta]] | ordo = [[Cryptomonadales]] | familia = [[Cryptomonadaceae]] | genus = '''''Cryptomonas''''' | genus_authority = Ehrenberg (1832) }} '''''Cryptomonas''''' is the name-giving genus of the [[cryptomonad]]s. It is common in freshwater habitats and often forms blooms in greater depths of lakes, or during winter beneath the ice. The cells are usually brownish in color, and have a slit-like furrow at the anterior. They are not known to produce any toxins and are used to feed small [[zooplankton]], which is the food source for small fish in fish farming.
